body: Provide a codesandbox version.  (reduce the amount of the custom build components that you potentially had as well to reduce side effects)

Hello @bluebill1049 
I've updated the description with codesandbox example
Also, I reduced the amount of code 

[Codesandbox:](https://codesandbox.io/s/heuristic-kirch-nnhth)
Please make sure that you go to the `Deployment` section and made a `production` build and deployed it to `Netlify`

Then please click the `Visit Site` link

![Codesandbox](https://github.com/Travellerme/react-hook-form-issue/raw/master/Codesandbox.png?raw=true "Codesandbox")

Thanks for providing the CSB link, however, it's not reasonable for me to inspect your entire app with all those side effects. I believe if there is an issue, you can reproduce that pretty quickly with native inputs by inspecting your UI blow: here is a CSB you can base on: https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-usefieldarray-vy8fv also it's important to isolate the issue with steps to help me identify the issue too.

Hello @bluebill1049 
I've removed all bootstrap / sass / lodash dependencies. 
Please take a [look](https://codesandbox.io/s/heuristic-kirch-nnhth)
Production behavior is the correct behavior. I am patching this by removing the production check under `useEffect`. This will impact react fast refresh, we are having a prop fix in v7.

@bluebill1049 
Hmm...If the production behavior is the correct one, then how it's possible in my example to make the form valid after unmounting   `fieldArray` with errors from DOM ? `reset` does not help

The usage should be a single useFieldArray instead of mounting and unmount multiple field array, but that's an implementation detail. Prod build is correct as the logic was intended that way because dev is the correct output by "accident".

I do understand that this is an implementation detail. But still, we need to have a possibility to have a kind of toggler that will allow us to have several `useFieldArray`  on the page with the possibility to unmount it. I tried to use 'clearErrors, reset, setValue' but nothing helped. 

Do you have any suggestions on how to make the form valid after unmounting `useFieldArray` or how to umount fieldArray correctly from `react-hook-form` ?

@bluebill1049 Yes, I did
Right now I have this issue both in `prod` and `dev` mode
[gif](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QXQuO3jOcKzm8jXd7c6OBGkGw4PzaL4f/view?usp=sharing)

From my point of view, this is a bug if there is no way to delete/reset fieldArray data from a form to make it valid.

issue.title: fix #4141 remove prod check at useEffect to fix dev/prod inconsistent behaviour

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body: This will impact react fast refresh and we fixed that in v7

issue.title: Bump react-hook-form from 6.15.1 to 6.15.4

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

repository.name: nextjs-dashboard-client
repository.description: Dashboard client application developed using Next.js and TypeScript.

issue.body:
Bumps [react-hook-form](https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form) from 6.15.1 to 6.15.4.
Release notes

Sourced from react-hook-form's releases.

Version 6.15.4

fix missing key for useFieldArray test fix #4259 correct unset on field array values (#4262)
fix #4260 watch missing type for undefined as the first argument (#4261)

v6.15.3

fix #4251 issue with re-render during unmount field array (#4252) fix: the issue of unmounted component trying to set state after reset for field arrays (#4150)

Version 6.15.2

fix #4219 Add default values when validating by using resolver (#4229) fix #4170 by removing field array @useEffect with shouldUnregister (#4172) fix #4141 remove prod check at useEffect to fix dev/prod inconsistent behavior (#4149)

Commits
  • 253f57d 6.15.4
  • 29f4cc1 fix missing key for useFieldArray test
  • ff5f163 fix #4259 correct unset on field array values (#4262)
  • 97d1105 fix #4260 watch missing type for undefined as first argument (#4261)
  • c67d145 6.15.3
  • 48db9ea fix #4251 issue with re-render during unmount field array (#4252)
  • 4dcf12a fix: issue of unmounted component trying to set state after reset for fiel...
  • 6d5b0da 6.15.2
  • 2e7a959 fix #4219 Add default values when validating by using resolver (#4229)
  • 45e8694 fix #4170 by remove field array @useEffect with shouldUnregister (#4172)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
